statement: Prove that the assertion \((a_1-a_2)(a_1-a_3)\cdots(a_1-a_n)+\cdots+(a_n-a_1)(a_n-a_2)\cdots(a_n-a_{n-1})\geq 0\) is true for \( n=3 \) and \( n=5 \), and false for every other natural number \( n>2 \).

Let \( P_1 \) be a convex polyhedron with nine vertices \( A_1,\ldots,A_9 \) and let \( P_i \) be the translate of \( P_1 \) sending \( A_1 \) to \( A_i \) (\( i=2,\ldots,9 \)). Prove that at least two of the polyhedra \( P_1,\ldots,P_9 \) have an interior point in common.
Prove that the set of integers of the form \( 2^k-3 \) (\( k=2,3,\ldots \)) contains an infinite subset in which every two members are relatively prime.

All faces of tetrahedron \( ABCD \) are acute-angled triangles. Consider closed polygonal paths \( XYZTX \) with \( X \) on \( AB \), \( Y \) on \( BC \), \( Z \) on \( CD \), \( T \) on \( DA \) (all distinct from vertices). (a) If \( \angle DAB + \angle BCD \neq \angle CDA + \angle ABC \), prove no path of minimal length exists. (b) If equality holds, prove infinitely many shortest paths exist, their common length being \( 2AC \sin(\alpha/2) \) where \( \alpha = \angle BAC + \angle CAD + \angle DAB \).

Prove that for every natural number \( m \) there exists a finite set \( S \) of points in the plane such that for every point \( A \) in \( S \) there are exactly \( m \) points of \( S \) at unit distance from \( A \).

Let \( A=(a_{ij}) \) be an \( n\times n \) matrix with non-negative integer entries. Suppose that whenever \( a_{ij}=0 \), the sum of the elements in the \( i \)-th row and the \( j \)-th column is \( \geq n \). Prove that the sum of all elements of the matrix is \( \geq n^2/2 \).
